description: Five years ago a change in the law stopped doctors helping the terminally ill to end their lives.
title: Germany overturns ban on professionally assisted suicide
title_page: Germany overturns ban on professionally assisted suicide - BBC News
maintext: Medical ethics expert Gita Neumann, who has provided advice and support for years to people in their 80s said she knew of no doctor in Germany who had helped with assisted suicide in the past five years, because of the new clause in the criminal code.
